The frequency table has space to write a total at the bottom of the frequency column. This helps you to know how many pieces of data were collected. In this example the student recorded the colours of cars in a car park. The total number of cars is 157.

A stem-and-leaf diagram allows you to organise and display grouped data using the actual data values. When you use a frequency table to organise grouped data you cannot see the actual data values, just the frequencies.

Sociologists and geographers sometimes draw population pyramids. These are sideways bar charts that show the numbers of people in various age categories. These charts look similar to stem-and-leaf diagrams.

In a stem-and-leaf diagram each data item is broken into two parts: a stem and a leaf. The final digit of each value is the leaf and the previous digits are the stem. The stems are written to the left of the vertical line and the leaves to the right.
This data set shows the ages of customers in a café one lunchtime.

Charts are useful for displaying data because you can see patterns and trends easily and quickly. You can also compare different sets of data easily. In this section you are going to revise what you already know about pictograms, bar charts, pie charts and line graphs.

A pictogram is a simple chart. Small symbols (pictures) are used to represent quantities. The meaning of the symbol and the amount it represents (a 'key') must be provided for the graph to make sense.

b How much time did Isobel spend on the phone that week?
c Who spent 1.5 hours on the phone that week?
d Draw the symbols you would use to show 2.5 hours.

A bar chart is normally used to display discrete data. The chart shows information as a series of bars plotted against a scale on the axis. The bars can be horizontal or vertical.
There are different methods of drawing bar charts, but all bar charts should have:

A dual bar chart displays two or more sets of data side-by-side on the same set of axes to make it easy to compare the data. This chart compares the percentage of Fortune 500 companies using different platforms.
A composite (stacked) bar chart breaks the whole set of data shown on each bar into groups.
The graph shows that Zawadi spent most of the time cycling (about 60%). By comparison, Kofi only spent about 30% of the time cycling.

One way of assessing a piece of work is to write a checklist. A checklist is an assessment tool. It is a list of statements that give the criteria you will use to measure skills or student success in completing a task.

Your statements should be clear, specific and easy to check. For example: The chart has a clear heading [ ] yes [ ] no
Leave space in your checklist to add comments. For example: Your heading has spelling mistakes in it. or The vertical scale needs to start at 0.
